title: The Bachelorette's Angie Kent talks about starting a family amid her battle with endometriosis
text:
Angie Kent has spoken out about her battle with endometriosis, claiming she'd need to start a family in the near future.

In an interview with NW magazine on Monday, the 29-year-old Bachelorette confessed she would need to start thinking seriously about having kids.

'I do have endometriosis, so it is one of those things I will have to think about earlier rather than later because it will make things quite hard for me later down the track to fall pregnant,' she admitted.

Baby talk: Angie Kent (pictured) has spoken out about her battle with endometriosis, claiming she'd need to start a family in the near future

But she added she didn't have a 'timeline' of when she would start a family, despite revealing she'd found love on the upcoming season of The Bachelorette.

'In terms of my timeline, I'm not big on marriage or having babies. If my partner wanted to have that, I'll think about it. I kind of let the universe decide,' she added.

In an interview with OK! magazine last week, Angie admitted she's never really thought about her wedding day.

Getting serious: In an interview with NW magazine on Monday, the 29-year-old Bachelorette confessed she would need to start thinking seriously about having kids

'I've never planned a wedding, even though a lot of girls do when they're younger. I've planned my funeral, which is a bit weird,' she laughed.

'I have the songs and everything. But if it's something my partner really wanted to do, I'd consider it.'

In an interview with The Daily Telegraph's Stellar magazine last month, Angie said she'd been happily single for 10 years prior to her appearance on The Bachelor.

Issues: 'I do have endometriosis, so it is one of those things I will have to think about earlier rather than later because it will make things quite hard for me later down the track...' she said

'I had three really good boyfriends right after the other. I started at 16 and stopped at 21. After that, I was more interested in travelling and studying, so I have not had a proper boyfriend since,' she confessed.

And she said she was determined to maintain her independence, even while filming the show.

'I didn't want to be morphed into a stereotypical Bachelorette. I wanted to feel like I [was] still me - strong and independent - and that the partner I pick would match that,' she added.
description: Angie Kent has spoken out about her battle with endometriosis, claiming she'd need to start a family soon. In an interview with NW, Angie confessed she would need to start thinking about having kids.
authors: Demeter Stamell For Daily Mail Australia
